name: hump
content:
hump noun
(LUMP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a large, round raised area or part: The car hit a hump in the road and swerved.speed hump UK Local residents are asking for speed humps (= raised areas across the road which make people drive slowly) to be installed in their street.
[ C ] a round raised part on a person's or animal's back: Some types of camel have two humps and others have one. See also
humpbacked

Idioms
get the hump
be over the hump
hump verb
(CARRY)
[ T usually + adv/prep ] informal to carry or lift something heavy with difficulty: My back really aches after humping those heavy boxes around all day.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to move someone or something from one place to anothercarryThese rail cars carry coal.haulHe grew up hauling coal out of the mines six days a week.cartThe suspects were carted away by police.lugI have to lug the shopping in from the car by myself!humpHe humped the mattress up to his third-floor flat by himself.schlepI need to schlep the trash to the curb.

hump verb
(HAVE SEX)
[ I or T ] offensive a rude word meaning to have sex (with someone)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large, round, raised lump or part: The car swerved when it hit a hump in the road.
A hump is also a round, raised part on a person’s or animal’s back: a camel’s hump
